alert.note: Alert for Franklin (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 6:03PM EDT until further notice by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Franklin, Granville, Vance, Wake and Warren. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 603 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Henderson, Oxford, Creedmoor, Warrenton, Butner, Franklinton, Norlina, Littleton, Kittrell, Stem, Middleburg, Macon, Gillburg, South Henderson, Dabney, Ingleside, Afton, Satterwhite Point Marina, Drewry and Steele Creek Marina & Campground. - This includes the following flood prone locations... US-1A at Cedar Creek, Green Hill Rd. at Middle Creek and McGee Creek and Lynch Creek at Dyking Rd. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
